intro: Zeuxine cochlearis, commonly known as the spiral bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking, spiral-arranged inflorescence that resembles a coiled shell. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves and blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. Zeuxine cochlearis thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows. Its unique floral structure and medicinal properties have made it a subject of botanical interest.
